item.title: 消息人士称，大众进一步推迟推出 Trinity 电动车
item.description: 一位接近大众汽车公司的人士周一晚些时候表示，大众汽车已将其下一代Trinity电动车项目中的新款ID.4车型的推出时间推迟到2030年代初，这是对被推迟的计划进行重新调整的一部分。【原文：Volkswagen has pushed back the launch of a new ID.4 model from its next generation Trinity EV project to the early 2030s as part of a reshuffling of plans for the delayed programme, a person close to the company said late on Monday.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡监管机构向马斯克的 Starlink 公司颁发卫星宽带许可证
item.description: 斯里兰卡总统的媒体部门表示，斯里兰卡电信监管机构已向埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）卫星部门 Starlink 颁发许可证，允许其从 8 月 12 日起在这个南亚岛国提供卫星宽带服务。【原文：Sri Lanka's telecommunications regulator has issued a licence to Elon Musk's Starlink, the satellite unit of SpaceX, to provide satellite broadband services in the South Asian island nation from Aug. 12, the president's media division said.】

item.title: 美国银行调查显示，8 月份投资者减少了股票配置，转而持有现金
item.description: 美国银行（BofA）周二公布的一项对基金经理的调查显示，由于对全球经济增长的预期降至8个月来的最低点，8月份投资者增加了现金配置，并减少了股票的超配头寸。【原文：Investors' increased their allocations to cash and reduced their an overweight position in stocks in August, as expectations for global growth dropped to its lowest in 8 months, a BofA survey of fund mangers published on Tuesday showed.】

item.title: Dispossessor 勒索软件组织被美国和欧洲当局关闭
item.description: 美国和德国当局周二表示，活跃于全球的犯罪勒索软件组织 Radar/Dispossessor 已被取缔，该组织的目标至少包括医疗保健和运输等行业的数十家公司。【原文：The globally active criminal ransomware group Radar/Dispossessor, which targeted at least dozens of companies in sectors including healthcare and transport, has been taken down, authorities in the United States and Germany said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国关键数据公布前欧洲股市寸步难行
item.description: 欧洲股市周二走高，原因是投资者在等待当天晚些时候公布的关键美国经济数据，以寻找有关美联储下一步利率举措的更多线索。【原文：European shares edged higher on Tuesday as investors awaited key U.S. economic data later in the day for more clues on the Federal Reserve's next rate move, although a handful of dour corporate earnings capped gains.】

item.title: 美国银行机构客户五周来首次成为美股净买家
item.description: 该银行在周二发布的一份报告中称，上周博雅证券的客户净买入美股近 60 亿美元，为五周以来首次，是自 2008 年以来的第十大流入量。【原文：BofA Securities clients last week were net buyers of U.S. stocks, to the tune of almost $6 billion, for the first time in five weeks in the 10th largest inflow since 2008, the bank said in a note released on Tuesday.】

item.title: 保时捷 SE 着眼于在 "极具吸引力 "的市场环境中进行进一步投资
item.description: 保时捷 SE 控股集团财务总监在周二发布上半年财报时表示，保时捷 SE 在财务上有能力考虑进一步投资，以实现投资组合的多样化。【原文：Porsche SE is in a position financially to consider further investments to diversify its portfolio, the holding group's finance chief said alongside first-half results on Tuesday.】

item.title: 由于经济不景气，离开新西兰的人数创下历史新高
item.description: 政府统计数据显示，随着失业率上升、利率居高不下、经济增长乏力，离开新西兰的人数创下历史新高。【原文：People are leaving New Zealand in record numbers as unemployment rises, interest rates remain high and economic growth is anaemic, government statistics show.】

item.title: 日本股市惨遭抛售后，海外投资者转为看跌
item.description: 在上周的动荡之后，全球投资者重新评估了经济前景和以日元为资金来源的交易的可行性，转而看跌一度受青睐的日本股市。【原文：Global investors are turning bearish on once-favoured Japanese stocks following last week's turbulence as they reassess economic prospects and the viability of yen-funded trades.】

item.title: 澳大利亚挑战者公司因前景光明、年度盈利超预期而攀升至 1 年半高点
item.description: 周二，Challenger Ltd 的股价升至近 16 个月以来的最高水平，原因是这家澳大利亚投资管理公司的年度盈利超出预期，同时投资者还对其 2025 财年的盈利前景表示乐观。【原文：Shares of Challenger Ltd rose to their highest levels in nearly 16 months on Tuesday after the Australian investment management firm beat estimates on annual earnings, while investors also cheered its fiscal 2025 earnings outlook.】

item.title: 美股恐慌情绪消退，但历史表明不可能迅速恢复平静
item.description: 在上周美国股市爆发波动之后，恐慌情绪似乎已经消退，但如果以史为鉴，市场可能在数月内都会保持不安。【原文：Panic appears to have faded following last week's outbreak of volatility in U.S. stocks, but if history is any guide, markets might remain jittery for months.】

item.title: 欧洲电动汽车发展背后的租赁模式面临崩溃风险
item.description: 业内高管表示，电动汽车的低转售价值迫使推动欧洲汽车市场发展的租赁公司在过去三年里将价格翻了一番，如果监管机构迫使他们过快地转向电动汽车，一些租赁公司威胁要完全退出这项业务。【原文：Low resale values for electric cars have pushed the leasing firms that drive Europe's auto market to double prices over the last three years and some are threatening to quit the business altogether if regulators force them to go electric too fast, industry executives say.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美国数据测试前日元走稳带动日经指数走高
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 什么是人民币套利交易，它与日元套利交易有何不同？
item.description: 以日元为资金来源的套利交易平仓所引发的全球市场抛售，将焦点转向了同样被广泛用作廉价融资货币的中国人民币。【原文：A global markets sell-off spurred by an unwinding of yen-funded carry trades has turned the spotlight on China's yuan, which is also used widely as a cheap funding currency.】

item.title: 日本批发通胀率升至近一年来最快水平
item.description: 周二的数据显示，由于日元疲软推高了本已居高不下的大宗商品进口费用，7 月份日本批发通胀加速，同比增长速度为 11 个月来最快。【原文：Japan's wholesale inflation accelerated in July, with the pace of year-on-year growth the fastest in 11 months, data showed on Tuesday, as a weak yen pushed up commodity import bills that were already high.】

item.title: 澳大利亚第二季度工资增速为一年来最慢
item.description: 澳大利亚 6 月份工资增长速度为一年来最慢，低于预期，而私营部门的增长放缓表明劳动力市场正在放缓。【原文：Australian wages rose at their slowest pace in a year in the June quarter, falling short of expectations, while softer gains in the private sector suggest the labour market was easing.】

item.title: 日本股市在美国数据大爆炸前提振亚洲股市
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市上涨，日本股市因日元走稳而领涨，交易商正在等待包括美国通胀报告在内的数据，以判断美联储在上周动荡后的政策前景。【原文：Asian stocks rose on Tuesday, led by Japanese shares on the back of a steady yen, with traders awaiting data including the U.S. inflation report to gauge the Federal Reserve's policy outlook after volatile moves last week.】

item.title: 澳大利亚第二季度工资增速为一年来最慢
item.description: 澳大利亚 6 月份工资增长速度为一年来最慢，这表明本轮经济周期的顶峰已经过去，仅凭工资增长并不能阻止降息。【原文：Australian wages rose at their slowest pace in a year in the June quarter, confirming the peak for this cycle had passed and wages alone would not be a bar to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 7 月商业形势反弹，成本压力缓解
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于就业率回升，澳大利亚 7 月份的商业状况有所改善，而由于高利率导致需求放缓，成本压力继续减轻。【原文：Australian business conditions improved in July due to a rebound in employment, a survey showed on Tuesday, while cost pressures continued to ease as high interest rates worked to slow demand.】

item.title: 市场重新关注需求忧虑，油价有所回落
item.description: 石油价格周二走低，打破了连续五天的涨势，原因是欧佩克周一下调了对2024年需求增长的预期，而中国的预期又有所放缓，因此市场重新关注对需求的担忧。【原文：Oil prices edged lower on Tuesday, breaking a five-day streak of gains, as markets refocused on concerns about demand after OPEC on Monday cut its forecast for demand growth in 2024 due to softer expectations in China.】

item.title: 美元绷紧神经，等待数据对降息风险的定论
item.description: 美元在周二陷入了困境，因为投资者在观望美国经济数据对大幅降息的影响，而日本股市的反弹则帮助抑制了日元套利交易的出血。【原文：The dollar was in limbo on Tuesday as investors waited to see how U.S. economic data affected the chance of outsized rate cuts, while a rally in Japanese stocks helped staunch the bleeding in yen carry trades.】

item.title: 澳大利亚消费者对加息的担忧有所缓解，减税政策也已启动
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于政府减税和其他生活成本措施的实施，澳大利亚消费者对利率的担忧有所缓解，家庭经济前景也有所改善，澳大利亚消费者情绪在8月份出现反弹。【原文：Australian consumer sentiment bounced in August as rate fears subsided and the outlook for family finances improved due to the government's tax cuts and other cost-of-living measures, a survey showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 新加坡第二季度国内生产总值同比增长 2.9%，与预估值持平
item.description: 新加坡政府周二公布的数据显示，4-6 月份新加坡经济同比增长 2.9%，与官方预估值持平，高于市场预期。【原文：Singapore's economy grew 2.9% in the April-June quarter from a year earlier, matching the official advance estimate and above market expectations, government data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 备忘录称花旗集团市场部门数字资产主管离职
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，花旗集团市场部门数字资产主管 Shobhit Maini 将在离职 14 年后离开该行。【原文：Citigroup's head of digital assets for its markets unit, Shobhit Maini, is leaving the bank after more than 14 years, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: Rho Motion称，7月份全球电动汽车销量增长21%，中国创下2024年最大增幅
item.description: 市场研究公司 Rho Motion 周一表示，尽管欧洲需求下降，但得益于中国今年最强劲的增长势头，7 月份全球全电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车的销量同比增长了 21%。【原文：Global sales of fully electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles rose by a yearly 21% in July, thanks to China's strongest growth this year and despite dropping demand in Europe, market research firm Rho Motion said Monday.】

item.title: 精神航空首席执行官沙纳汉将获得 2850 万美元的 "金降落伞
item.description: 根据周一提交的一份监管文件，在这家 737 MAX 机身供应商完成与波音公司的合并后，精神航空系统公司首席执行官帕特里克-沙纳汉（Patrick Shanahan）将获得 2850 万美元的报酬。【原文：Spirit AeroSystems CEO Patrick Shanahan will receive a payout of $28.5 million after the 737 MAX fuselage supplier completes its merger with Boeing , according to a regulatory filing on Monday.】

item.title: 亚洲 新发现的市场平静等待动荡考验
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 埃克森裁员 59 人，收购先锋公司后开始裁员
item.description: 根据向德克萨斯州劳动力委员会提交的文件，埃克森美孚将裁员 59 人，其中二叠纪盆地 10 人，达拉斯 39 人。【原文：Exxon Mobil is laying off 59 employees, including 10 in the Permian Basin and 39 in Dallas, according to a filing with the Texas Workforce Commission.】

item.title: J&J公司获得索赔人足够支持，达成65亿美元的滑石粉和解协议 - 彭博社
item.description: 据彭博社报道，强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）拟以 65 亿美元的价格解决数万起指控其婴儿爽身粉和其他滑石粉产品致癌的诉讼案，该提议已迈过了获得支持的关键门槛。【原文：Johnson & Johnson has cleared a key threshold of support for its proposed $6.5 billion settlement of tens of thousands of lawsuits alleging its baby powder and other talc products caused cancer, according to a Bloomberg report.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行前首席财务官以性别陈规定型观念为由起诉加拿大银行不当解聘
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行前首席财务官纳丁-安（Nadine Ahn）对该银行提起了不当解雇诉讼，并声称 "基于性别的刻板印象 "是她被解雇的原因之一。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada's former CFO Nadine Ahn has filed a wrongful-termination lawsuit against the bank, and alleged that "gender-based stereotyping" was at play in her dismissal.】
